intro: Hieracium grandipetalum, commonly known as the large-petaled hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its showy, yellow-orange flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium grandipetalum is often found in open habitats and can spread rapidly through its rhizomatous growth system.
